title: Starbucks Is Testing Ice Cream And Coffee Drinks
text:
Starbucks Is Testing Ice Cream And Coffee Drinks February 15, 2017 9:28 AM Filed Under: Starbucks 
NEW YORK (AP) — Starbucks plans to start testing concoctions that mix coffee and ice cream. 
The Seattle chain said it will serve “affogato” varieties of hot or cold coffee over ice cream at 100 stores in Orange County, California, starting Wednesday, with pricier versions sold at 10 locations with its “reserve” bars. A post shared by Starbucks Reserve Roastery (@starbucksroastery) on Jul 22, 2016 at 4:47pm PDT 
Spokeswoman Holly Hart Shafer said the treats were first introduced at the company’s Roastery store in Seattle, which is a pipeline for potential new menu items. She noted that “affogato” means “drowned” in Italian. The priciest version at regular stores is a 12-ounce option that costs $6.45 and mixes cold brew coffee with ice cream. A post shared by Starbucks Reserve Roastery (@starbucksroastery) on Jun 27, 2016 at 5:27pm PDT 
The test was first reported by Business Insider. 
Starbucks Corp. has successfully driven up sales over the years in part by introducing pricier new items.
